There has been no complete veterinary exams for the adults dogs in the kennel since September 20th, 2023. There were
no exams scheduled at the time of inspection. Veterinary exams are required to protect the health and wellbeing of the
dogs.
In addition the licensee was using a computerized medical record system to keep records of vaccines and dewormers
provided by the facility. The system had a schedule of planned activities but the treatments were not being saved to
individual dogs when they were completed. Medical records for dogs shall be kept and maintained by the dealer or
exhibitor for at least 1 year after the dog is euthanized or disposed of by the facility.
A complete physical exam from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is required not less then once every
12 months. Medical records must be updated.
Correction by January 31st, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
